title: Features required in next update
comment: Thanks for the reply  1. Image share in group (which will work on HTTPS) 2. Voice share in group (HTTPS) 3. Emoticons. 4. Internal audio player so that we can play the received audio without using another audio player.
The HttpUploadComponent already works with HTTPS. You just have to set it up properly. Read the README again

title: Best one I've used
comment: Stable with regular updates and new features. Keep them coming.

title: Perfect
comment: Modern feature wise, modern ui, actively developed, almost feature complete. Looks much like hangouts, I just wish there were a similar desktop application. I'm excited to try the new share feature, it will make Conversations on pair with hangouts chat etc.
So far so good

title: Doesn't work with YubiKey GPG
comment: Bought this intending to use it with OpenKeychain (like I do for Password Store and K-9 Mail). It fails when I try to publish my key to RiseUp's server. Given that my other apps work fine with YubiKey and OpenKeychain, I think it's an issue with this app.

title: Must add
comment: 1-group image share; 2-group voice share

File sharing in non-anonymous groups is possible as of version 1.5.0
This requires a server side extension you can find here: https://github.com/siacs/HttpUploadComponent
The best XMPP app around. Puts the others to shame.

title: Best XMPP client I've come across!
comment: Would love it if you could add an emoticons feature :)

title: Jabber ON XMPP, not Jabber / XMPP
comment: The account setup screen assumes that you are trying to connect to a Jabber service, but I was looking for a way to consolidate all of my XMPP based communications. This is not designed for that, apparently.

Hi, can you send an email to inputmice@siacs.eu quickly explaining what you mean by 'XMPP based communications'? Usually Jabber and XMPP are considered synonyms. Jabber technically being a brand name though.
Conversations should be able to connect to all XMPP based IM services.

title: The best XMPP
comment: Full features that really works.  Nothing in IOS that works properly in group chat,  so please please have it available in IOS too.

title: This app is awesome!
comment: Between all the crappy or battery-eating Jabber apps, this one definitely stands out. This app brings Jabber's user experience back in par with Hangouts!

title: Wonderful
comment: Great design and use of the XMPP protocol. I wish there were more clients like this.

title: Good and clean design
comment: Nice UI update :D
This is exactly what I'd expect from any messaging client designed for Android Lollipop.

title: Great App
comment: Would have given 5 if it supported (somehow) sharing of pictures to group.

title: Best XMPP mobile client for android, hands down
comment: I just wish there was a good desktop client that looked like this. Gajim is great, but a bit buggy.

title: One of the best Jabber clients I've come across
comment: Would be nice to get some more basic functions built in, current status of your contact in the icon rather than having to check the send button within a conversation.  Also, an option to see all contacts by default, rather than having to add a new conversation to see who is online.
If you would like to see your contacts presence in the contact list try enabling 'Dynamic Tags'

title: Works nicely for me
comment: Support very quickly fixed an initial problem that prevented the client working for me.  Some nice features, although not perfect.   Some comments sent privately
This problem has been fixed in 1.3.0

title: lack of settings options
comment: I really like the looks of the app. But very disappointing with the lack of settings. All I get is username and password? What about the setup of my specific xmpp server details?  Have asked for a refund.
please read http://conversations.im/#dns

title: Didn't work
comment: Nice interface, but other side doesn't get media
Please contact our support at inputmice@siacs.eu and describe your problem in more detail

title: Great when it works
comment: I have my own xmpp server and when I use another android app it works perfect but when I use this one messages have to be sent multiple multiple times for them to go through.
Please contact our support at inputmice@siacs.eu and describe your problem in more detail

title: Needs More Settings (perhaps)
comment: Couldn't edit handle for group chats, and thus couldn't get into them. Otherwise, app did what it claimed.  EDIT: Author clarified how to add handle for group chat. Will be pulling this into my daily driver and use it.

You can enter the full jid in the join conference dialog. eg room@server.tld/yournick but thats only necessary for IRC transports and the like. In normal group chats you should just see a warning nick already in use with an option to edit your nick.

title: Gread Integration...
comment: ...look and feel. Only thing missing for me is control over resource priorities. Thanks for the great work.

title: Awesome Jabber app
comment: Great UI, lots of features

title: Functional & Beautiful
comment: Conversations is the best XMPP client for Android by leaps and bounds. Well done!

title: Easy to use, but dumbed down to Hangouts level
comment: OK to use on the go, but not a proper Jabber client. I don't agree with developer's approach of not supporting statuses, priorities, and auto away. Those are basic XMPP features that have worked well for me for over 10 years. Also quite a few features one would expect from a Jabber client are missing, e.g. service discovery, gateway support, forms, user search, etc. Can't work with the roster properly (assign groups, etc) and the idea of read-only 'dynamic tags' is simply ridiculous.

title: Awesome with glitches.
comment: Spent the last months again and again switching between Xabber and this one. Pro: Conversations is gorgeous, fast, very low on battery, provides a good set of features and has a very lean, usable UI. Cons: A load of things that work out of the box with Xabber on my infrastructure (shared message archive / history, mobile client with lower priority than desktop clients so messages show up on the desktop if online there, delayed receiving of messages while offline) do not work as easily with Conversations.... :(

Conversations supports Message Archive Managment which is the successor of Message Archive read this: http://conversations.im/#synchronization
Also Conversations supports Carbons for live message synchronization
Is it possible to add possibility to read message history for gtalk account?

title: Doesn't support HTML
comment: Apparently all kinds of other clients use HTML-like tags in messages for fonts, line breaks and so on. Those tags are displayed in this app as they are, so some messages are barely readable. If this gets fixed, five stars.

title: Fantastic client.
comment: Just all-around fantastic, everything is great. It would be perfect if we could get:  * More XMPP settings (e.g. set domain and chat server separately). * A menu item to completely log off and close the app (for when I don't want to be online).

title: beautifully designed, feature filled
comment: after running with jabber clients that looked like they came out of android 2, it was nice to come across an app that is modern and functional. worth every cent.

title: Phenomenal!
comment: An incredible XMPP client. All it needs is a dark theme option to save my feeble eyes.

title: Cant Create an Account
comment: Pl help me how to create an account. It says unauthorized whenever I try to create one
Please contact our support at daniel@siacs.eu and describe your problem in more detail. Are you using a OpenFire server?

title: Best XMPP Client
comment: We using as Olark chat support and its works fine. I like modern UI. Please make desktop version too :) Great and fast app without big bugs. Recommended.

title: Beautiful and functional client
comment: I like the Google Hangouts look, as I was looking for a new client to use now that Google has killed its XMPP servers. This look is familiar.  It performs adequately to my needs: easy configuration, quiet hours setting, sending and receiving pictures. However, I can't find the "Desktop Client" mentioned in the decription above. It's not on your website. For a desktop client I use Pidgin at the moment, and unfortately pictures sent with this app don't show in pidgin.  This is the only downside of the app (and I don't know if the problem is with this app or with Pidgin). Please direct me to your aforementioned desktop app and I will add a star to my rating :-)

title: Fantastic
comment: This feels like a real client for modern devices!  I really like this!  Keep up the great work!

title: Excellent client!
comment: Not only does this look like a 2015 messaging app, it also has the features one expects of modern IM software (if your server supports it). Running this with a self-hosted Prosody makes for a killer WhatsApp alternative!

title: Great client , apart from some instabilities
comment: Great , lightweight and simple client with enough features build in! But I personally have been having issues with the client randomly disconnecting from 1 account , sometimes both... Rather annoying , but still a nice client :)

title: Great XMPP client
comment: Conversations is a very lightweight and simple XMPP client, but with a lot of advanced features implemented. Not only you can send messages, photos, audio records and files, you can encrypt your conversation using OTR or a OpenPGP bridge.  The UI is simple, modern and fast, and the code is Open Source for you to learn or improve whatever you need.  Is by far the best Android client I've found.
Excellent and thanks for making it opensource, that sold it for me!
Best XMPP Client for Android
I like this client. Very little resources required and do not drain the battery. Design is simple and clear. However could be great if you have a choice for dark theme.

title: Best Android XMPP client
comment: Easily the best Android XMPP client around! You only need a server that supports the extensions and you'll have a nice WhatsApp  replacement.

title: Great app
comment: One request though would be to use the last received message in the body of notifications for group chats. Otherwise it's pretty much perfect.

title: Every version an  improvement
comment: Glad, I waited with my review since this app gets better and better with every update and a lot of the small and annoying stuff is fixed now. A lot of good features have been added as well. And it's stable now, haven't experienced a crash with the two latest versions. One of the purchases I really enjoy!

title: Nice app. Some in completions
comment: What I want to see before I can give a higher review is the ability to display all online contacts and sort contacts by status. Im using jabber as instant messaging. Not as an SMS replacement

title: Great!
comment: Best design of any XMPP client I tried.  Support for server autodiscovery great support for conferences/groups.  At work I have 1000+ contacts, handled them fine.  Missing: - Icon sync - Contact groups

title: Works great
comment: love it more and more and more... can't wait to see a material design version ;)
To see who's online have a look at the options 'use send button to indicate status' and 'show dynamic tags'

title: Very much appreciated
comment: Works as advertised. I was a long time user of IM Pro but lateley they have issues with notifications and battery drain.
Have a look at the preferences 'Use send button to indicate status' and 'show dynamic tags'

title: Awesome
comment: Very decent XMPP client

title: Simply the best!
comment: Far superior to other Android XMPP clients I've tried (and I've tried quite a few). Beautiful UI, very fast, and most importantly for me, has both simple OTR integration that actually plays nice with other XMPP clients like Pidgin, and group conversations. Worth every penny.

title: On the right track to be the best, but...
comment: A few crashes and a high amount of data transferred give me the impression that there is still a lot of bug fixing and polishing to do. For example, it filled my phone storage with 238 copies of an image. I'm using it to connect to standard XMPP servers and HipChat rooms.

title: Good looking, minor features missing
comment: Unlike other clients, the roster is not front and center. That makes contact management annoying. Also, there is no sort by status and the indicators are not visible by default. Definitely the most beautiful Android XMPP client though.

title: Excellent
comment: Great app. Fast, simple and smooth. Works well with Facebook chat and Google talk

title: Clean but lacking
comment: Great, clean interface. It sadly doesn't show anything anywhere indicating online/offline status of contacts. I'd like to be able to quickly tell if my coworkers are available for chat or not rather than sending and praying.
To see who's online have a look at the options 'use send button to indicate status' and 'show dynamic tags'

title: El millor client de XMPP
comment: És de llarg el millor client per xmpp/jabber i l'únic amb transferència de fitxers a Android!

title: Nice - but needs custom ports and black theme
comment: The lack of custom ports to allow me to manually configure port 443 to get around firewalls (note: I _cannot_ "ask the admin" of Google to add 443 to their SRV record!) and the lack of a dark theme are real drawbacks though.

title: best client
comment: hands down. worth the money!

title: where are the extended configurations ?
comment: Terrible application,  I can't configure my account due this doesn't provide extending settings, yes custom ports and url, is any way to by pass this ? I think setting SRV on server will be extremely hard
What kind of extended settings are you talking about? Custom Host / Port? If so please read the FAQ entry https://github.com/siacs/Conversations#where-can-i-set-up-a-custom-hostname--port
The best XMPP client for android
Nice app, and great support!
An update has been pushed to the Play Store. I hope this will resolve your problems. I'm sorry for any inconvenience

title: not too bad, but...
comment: really nice app - however the option to keep it active by placing it in notification area is missing - hence "closing" the app causes some problems... (connection interruption)

title: Better than 'classic' apps
comment: Nice UI, good performance. Lots of features.

title: Good, but needs dark theme.
comment: BTW, thank you for the open sources.

title: Great UI, but app still needs improvement.
comment: Whilst the apps UI make it a pleasure to use, it still needs some improvement in the core. Simple thinks like sending files is limited to images only etc.
Conversations can send any kind of files since version 0.9

title: Amazing
comment: Tried about 15 xmpp Android apps... Literally... This was by far the best.  Took me awhile to figure out how to PM (hold down on avatar), but otherwise great!  Improvement to make is to use xmpp server avatars.  Another program did this, so I know it is possible.  I'd also like to be able to start a private conversation with someone from within a conversation (instead of whispering)
Great App
Very promising, looks good, works great for the most part, some improvements and it will be perfect

title: Finally!
comment: Finally a great and usable XMPP-Client. And its even OpenSource! Thank you so mich for making Theiß!

title: Shows promise, but missing key features
comment: Joining conferences works better in this app than any other android XMPP client I've tried, but I'm missing the ability to sign out, manually set my own presence, and use my server-side contact groups. I'd also like the option to NOT have the app start on boot. I use this to connect to my work IM on my personal phone and I don't want to appear online outside my work hours.

Hi,
you can disable (log out) an account by long pressing on the account in 'manage account' and selecting 'temporarily disable'

title: Nearly perfect.
comment: I give 5 starts because it is the best, but please, add option to hide offline contacts also, implement a way to see who is online and who is not just by lookin at contact list. Thanks!!!!

title: Awesome client
comment: If you want an XMPP/Jabber client, this is your best choice. It's fast, has nice group notifications, and feels right at home alongside other Android apps like Hangouts.

title: Nice Update
comment: New UI update looks very clean

title: Definitely Promising
comment: This app represents a great deal of work and an unusual amount of attention to UI aesthetics, which on Android is definitely refreshing for a messaging app of any kind. Unfortunately I have a good deal of trouble connecting to my own XMPP servers through this app, and I don't really have a lot of options at my disposal to try and fix that in this app. I would love to eventually see something like Xabber's "Custom Host" menu (which allows one to specify the server IP/FQDN and port without a SRV record or if/when it needs to be overridden, e.g. when you're behind the server's own router), though admittedly my own situation might be a bit niche. Other than this and the issue with GTalk messages constantly failing, this app is off to a fantastic start, and I look forwarding to playing with it more as it progresses.

title: Shows promise
comment: Not a bad client, but the UI (in my opinion) is ugly and unintuitive. I would like the option to show online friends only and how does one close an existing chat? I love that you can send files and the encryption support is nice. But the UI, guys....

title: Nice~~
comment: Looks really nice, is fast and allows encryption. And it's even OpenSource – best client out there.

title: Great, simple app
comment: This lets me keep up with my friends on Facebook and Google Talk without having to run either of their bloated, invasive clients, while also connecting to more modern xmpp servers and supporting encrypted chats. It does this with 20% of the code size of ChatSecure, and so feels snappy and reliable. On top of that, the devs are responsive to issues and pull requests.

title: Excellent, but
comment: If there's a way to join existing conferences, I can't find it. Most of the app, A+ but that's a total deal breaker, and so frustrating that it's not there!
In more recent versions there is a dedicated Tab for joining conferences. If you like you can have another look - and maybe update your review. Thanks

title: Nice UI but search could be improved
comment: App was really easy to setup to use work's Jabber server although there was a untrusted certificate issue on first connecting (a notification to say this would be nice).  Using the app is easy and I prefer it over the old app I used Xabber. One thing I found lacking was the search functionality. While it shows the list of people on the server it didn't look for rooms on the conference subdomain on the server which meant I was unable to connect to the group chats there.

title: Looks great
comment: Looks and works great!  It would be nice to have the ability to strip html formatting from incoming messages.  Some other clients send it by default and it's a horrible mess of raw html in Conversations.  I'd also like to be able to send pictures, preferably with the image being encrypted as well (not sure how that works with OTR, though)
Concerning the HTML I created an issue on github for you https://github.com/siacs/Conversations/issues/23 and file transfer (possible encrypted) is the main feature of the upcoming 0.2 release.

title: Great UI and nice features
comment: The support for message carbons is huge! The UI is great (though can we request a dark theme?). Also, is there a way to group the contact list by status and/or roster group?

Thank you for feedback. Conversations was designed with the idea that you would very rarely open the contact list and just keep conversations open instead of archiving them. I will however take your feedback into account for version 0.2 and see if I can improve the filtering within the contact list.

title: Best Jabber Client for mobile I've seen so far
comment: Full Disclosure: The developer of this app is a friend of mine.  I've been beta-testing this app for a while, and it is the first XMPP client that I've actually found myself using quite a bit. It's built with a clean design and is packed with obscure-but-useful features.  I especially appreciate the nice balance of customizability and simplicity, where other clients tend to err on the side of too many options. This results in a really streamlined, well thought-out user experience. One can tell that a great deal of attention is payed to UX design. Another thing that makes this client really stick out is the support for various XEPs, which really, noticably improve mobility performance.   Keep in mind that this is a somewhat early version of the app, so occasionally, I still run into bugs, but these are usually fixed very quickly by the developer.
